instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook won’t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message: I don't know how this type of board works, can you help me with the measures to take; only 5v 20ma en tester

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message:
Did you try DFU?
Any history available?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message: THE ONLY WAY TO DFU, IS WITH ANOTHER LAPTOP M1 CONNECT IT? client said that it discharged the battery and it did not turn on again

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message:
You can do it even with older USB 3 model, using correct cable.
Original Apple Tunderbolt 3 cable, using another USB-C MacBook (2016, or newer), is the recommended way.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message: I already tried dfu problem persists

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message:
any story? previous technician reballed the 2 <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>
a question I have <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> other logic board macbook air 2018 retina,  it is compatible with logic board 2020 <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>?
where buy <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message:
Just look at schematics to understand not compatible chips.
If no donor board available, try Aliexpress; pray hard in such case.

Maybe not worth to invest time in this machine, if someone else already worked on it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message: change <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP> and the equipment turned on, but it does not recognize the battery, an x appears, will it be a battery problem or a chip change, I do not have batteries for this model to check, any specific test o measure?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.
Known good working battery may be the only way to discard battery issue.
